did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Letter and Card of Theodore Roosevelt, 17 July 1912, n.d.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Letter and Card of Theodore Roosevelt, Accession # 5844-e, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was transferred from the Rare Book Division on 24 June 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a letter, 1912 July 7, Roosevelt to Byron Phelps, thanking him for a letter and a check. A White House card with Roosevelt's signature is also included.

did.unittitle: Letter from Theodore Roosevelt to Byron Phelps 17 July 1912
did.physdesc: TLS, 1 page, laid into the first volume of The Winning of the Westby Theodore Roosevelt (Barrett PS2734R5W65 1889 v.1)

scopecontent.p: Theodore Roosevelt, on The Outlookstationery, New York City, to Byron Phelps, Seattle, Washington. Roosevelt writes, "I thank you for your letter and also for the check for twenty dollars, which I have sent to the Treasurer. I appreciate your courtesy very much, and it was particularly pleasing to get such a letter from a former Mayor of Seattle."

did.unittitle: Signature of Theodore Roosevelt on a White House calling card n.d.

scopecontent.p: Signature of Theodore Roosevelt on a White House calling card, with unaddressed envelope, laid into the first volume of The Winning of the Westby Theodore Roosevelt.
